thread.title: Humble Kiwi pie pays out $3.8 million on Lotto
thread.title_full: Humble Kiwi pie pays out $3.8 million on Lotto

author: Dileepa Fonseka
title: Humble Kiwi pie pays out $3.8 million on Lotto
text:
Humble Kiwi pie pays out $3.8 million on Lotto DILEEPA FONSEKA Last updated 13:15, February 28 2017 MICHAEL BRADLEY/ LOTTO NZ 
She went to buy a pie - but bought a lucky ticket instead. 
A pie has proven healthy for one mother's bank balance, to the tune of $3.8 million. 
The West Auckland mother only decided to buy her winning Lotto ticket because her son was buying a pie at the bakery nearby. 
"When I got to the counter I handed the man a $20 note and said 'give me the luckiest ticket you have, please'." 
As she was getting ready to go to sleep on Saturday night she read online that the winning ticket had been sold at the Avondale Foodmarket Lotto shop. 
READ MORE: * Invercargill Lotto winner slept with ticket under her pillow 
"But I couldn't remember the name of the shop I bought my ticket at so I decided to just go to bed." 
The woman eventually gave in to her own curiosity and decided to check how her numbers stacked up next to the winning ones. 
"That's when I saw the numbers lining up on the second-to-bottom line of my ticket. I kept muttering 'nah, nah' as I saw each number – then I saw I had the right Powerball number and then I knew I was in trouble." 
She was so stunned she called her son to double-check, and her son was so shocked he woke his girlfriend up to confirm his mother's winnings. 
"I blearily checked the numbers – they were all there. I honestly thought I was still dreaming – she's a hardworking single mum, so this really is the kind of thing you dream of someone like her winning," he said. Ad Feedback 
The winner says her top priorities for the money are paying off the mortgage and buying herself a new fridge. 
"I'm not too sure what else I'll do to be honest, I just know I want to do some good." - Stuff
